channel.title: Comments on: Code Sharing (PowerShell): Create Pull Request via VSTS REST API
channel.description: A blog about things I learn at the keyboard: DevOps, CI/CD, Cloud, Automation, to name a few....

item.title: By: Jan Errol
item.dc:creator: Jan Errol
item.description: What is the minimum scope of access should the token have to be able to create a pull request?
item.content:encoded: What is the minimum scope of access should the token have to be able to create a pull request?

item.title: By: Ahmad Hassan
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Hassan
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/2017/create-vsts-pull-request-via-vsts-rest-api/#comment-11083">Marcus</a>.
Marcus Thanks a lot for your response. But in my case when i create a pull request through rest API for a specific branch workitems does not automatically pop up. But when i manually create a pull request in azure devops they do link automatically.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Marcus.

Marcus
Thanks a lot for your response. But in my case when i create a pull request through rest API for a specific branch workitems does not automatically pop up. But when i manually create a pull request in azure devops they do link automatically.

item.title: By: Marcus
item.dc:creator: Marcus
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/2017/create-vsts-pull-request-via-vsts-rest-api/#comment-11078">Ahmad Hassan</a>.
Hey Ahmad,
Any commits/branches that have associated work items will automatically be linked to the pull request. If the PR doesn't have any, you can use the <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/azure/devops/git/pull%20requests/update?view=azure-devops-rest-5.1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow ugc">Pull Requests - Update API</a> and pass in workItemRefs.
Hope this helps, Marcus
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ahmad Hassan.

Hey Ahmad,

Any commits/branches that have associated work items will automatically be linked to the pull request. If the PR doesn’t have any, you can use the Pull Requests – Update API and pass in workItemRefs.

Hope this helps,
Marcus

item.title: By: Ahmad Hassan
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Hassan
item.description: Greetings Thank you very much for the wonderful work you have done Its really help. Further i want anther help how to associate work items too with the pull request. How can we achieve it.
item.content:encoded:
Greetings
Thank you very much for the wonderful work you have done Its really help. Further i want anther help how to associate work items too with the pull request. How can we achieve it.

item.title: By: Venkat
item.dc:creator: Venkat
item.description: Thank you very much Sir, I may not have done it this well.
item.content:encoded: Thank you very much Sir, I may not have done it this well.

item.title: By: Adithya
item.dc:creator: Adithya
item.description: I have been looking for a solution for the exact same problem. Merging code automatically from Release branch to all user branches. The script is beautifully written explaining every detail in comments. Thank you very much for sharing the same.
item.content:encoded: I have been looking for a solution for the exact same problem. Merging code automatically from Release branch to all user branches. The script is beautifully written explaining every detail in comments. Thank you very much for sharing the same.
